member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.AdditionalInstanceConfiguration
member.summary: In addition to your infrastruction configuration, these settings provide an extra layer of control over your build instances. For instances where Image Builder installs the Systems Manager agent, you can choose whether to keep it for the AMI that you create. You can also specify commands to run on launch for all of your build instances.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.AdditionalInstanceConfiguration.SystemsManagerAgent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SystemsManagerAgent.
Contains settings for the Systems Manager agent on your build instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.AdditionalInstanceConfiguration.UserDataOverride
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserDataOverride.
Use this property to provide commands or a command script to run when you launch your build instance.
The userDataOverride property replaces any commands that Image Builder might have added to ensure that Systems Manager is installed on your Linux build instance. If you override the user data, make sure that you add commands to install Systems Manager, if it is not pre-installed on your base image.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion
member.summary: The defining characteristics of a specific version of an Amazon Web Services TOE component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.
Semantic versioning is included in each object's Amazon Resource Name (ARN), at the level that applies to that object as follows:
Versionless ARNs and Name ARNs do not include specific values in any of the nodes. The nodes are either left off entirely, or they are specified as wildcards, for example: x.x.x.
Version ARNs have only the first three nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>
Build version ARNs have all four nodes, and point to a specific build for a specific version of an object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion.DateCreated
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateCreated.
The date that the component was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion.Owner
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Owner.
The owner of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion.Platform
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Platform.
The platform of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion.SupportedOsVersions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SupportedOsVersions.
he operating system (OS) version supported by the component. If the OS information is available, a prefix match is performed against the base image OS version during image recipe creation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of the component denotes whether the component is used to build the image or only to test it.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ComponentVersion.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The semantic version of the component.
The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.
Assignment: For the first three nodes you can assign any positive integer value, including zero, with an upper limit of 2^30-1, or 1073741823 for each node. Image Builder automatically assigns the build number to the fourth node.
Patterns: You can use any numeric pattern that adheres to the assignment requirements for the nodes that you can assign. For example, you might choose a software version pattern, such as 1.0.0, or a date, such as 2021.01.01.
Filtering: With semantic versioning, you have the flexibility to use wildcards (x) to specify the most recent versions or nodes when selecting the base image or components for your recipe. When you use a wildcard in any node, all nodes to the right of the first wildcard must also be wildcards.

The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The data of the component. Used to specify the data inline. Either data or uri can be used to specify the data within the component.

member.summary:

The description of the component. Describes the contents of the component.

member.summary:

The ID of the KMS key that should be used to encrypt this component.

member.summary:

The name of the component.

member.summary:

The platform of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.CreateComponentRequest.SemanticVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SemanticVersion.
The semantic version of the component. This version follows the semantic version syntax.
The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.
Assignment: For the first three nodes you can assign any positive integer value, including zero, with an upper limit of 2^30-1, or 1073741823 for each node. Image Builder automatically assigns the build number to the fourth node.
Patterns: You can use any numeric pattern that adheres to the assignment requirements for the nodes that you can assign. For example, you might choose a software version pattern, such as 1.0.0, or a date, such as 2021.01.01.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.CreateComponentRequest.SupportedOsVersions
member.summary:

The operating system (OS) version supported by the component. If the OS information is available, a prefix match is performed against the base image OS version during image recipe creation.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.CreateComponentRequest.Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Uri.
The uri of the component. Must be an Amazon S3 URL and the requester must have permission to access the Amazon S3 bucket. If you use Amazon S3, you can specify component content up to your service quota. Either data or uri can be used to specify the data within the component.

member.summary:

The base image of the image recipe. The value of the string can be the ARN of the base image or an AMI ID. The format for the ARN follows this example: arn:aws:imagebuilder:us-west-2:aws:image/windows-server-2016-english-full-base-x86/x.x.x. You can provide the specific version that you want to use, or you can use a wildcard in all of the fields. If you enter an AMI ID for the string value, you must have access to the AMI, and the AMI must be in the same Region in which you are using Image Builder.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.DeleteImageRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteImage operation. Deletes an Image Builder image resource. This does not delete any EC2 AMIs or ECR container images that are created during the image build process. You must clean those up separately, using the appropriate Amazon EC2 or Amazon ECR console actions, or API or CLI commands.
To deregister an EC2 Linux AMI, see Deregister your Linux AMI in the Amazon EC2 User Guide .
To deregister an EC2 Windows AMI, see Deregister your Windows AMI in the Amazon EC2 Windows Guide .
To delete a container image from Amazon ECR, see Deleting an image in the Amazon ECR User Guide.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageBuildVersionArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Image Builder image resource to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image
member.summary: An Image Builder image. You must specify exactly one recipe for the image – either a container recipe (containerRecipe), which creates a container image, or an image recipe (imageRecipe), which creates an AMI.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image.
Semantic versioning is included in each object's Amazon Resource Name (ARN), at the level that applies to that object as follows:
Versionless ARNs and Name ARNs do not include specific values in any of the nodes. The nodes are either left off entirely, or they are specified as wildcards, for example: x.x.x.
Version ARNs have only the first three nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>
Build version ARNs have all four nodes, and point to a specific build for a specific version of an object.

The recipe that is used to create an Image Builder container image.

The date on which this image was created.

The distribution configuration used when creating this image.

Collects additional information about the image being created, including the operating system (OS) version and package list. This information is used to enhance the overall experience of using EC2 Image Builder. Enabled by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image.ImageRecipe
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image.OutputResources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputResources.
The output resources produced when creating this image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image.Platform
member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image.SourcePipelineName
member.summary:

The name of the image pipeline that created this image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The state of the image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags of the image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Specifies whether this is an AMI or container image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Image.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The semantic version of the image.
The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.
Assignment: For the first three nodes you can assign any positive integer value, including zero, with an upper limit of 2^30-1, or 1073741823 for each node. Image Builder automatically assigns the build number to the fourth node.
Patterns: You can use any numeric pattern that adheres to the assignment requirements for the nodes that you can assign. For example, you might choose a software version pattern, such as 1.0.0, or a date, such as 2021.01.01.
Filtering: With semantic versioning, you have the flexibility to use wildcards (x) to specify the most recent versions or nodes when selecting the base image or components for your recipe. When you use a wildcard in any node, all nodes to the right of the first wildcard must also be wildcards.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImageVersion
member.summary: The defining characteristics of a specific version of an Image Builder image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImageVersion.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a specific version of an Image Builder image.
Semantic versioning is included in each object's Amazon Resource Name (ARN), at the level that applies to that object as follows:
Versionless ARNs and Name ARNs do not include specific values in any of the nodes. The nodes are either left off entirely, or they are specified as wildcards, for example: x.x.x.
Version ARNs have only the first three nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>
Build version ARNs have all four nodes, and point to a specific build for a specific version of an object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImageVersion.DateCreated
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DateCreated.
The date on which this specific version of the Image Builder image was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImageVersion.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of this specific version of an Image Builder image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImageVersion.OsVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OsVersion.
The operating system version of the Amazon EC2 build instance. For example, Amazon Linux 2, Ubuntu 18, or Microsoft Windows Server 2019.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImageVersion.Owner
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Owner.
The owner of the image version.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImageVersion.Platform
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Platform.
The platform of the image version, for example "Windows" or "Linux".

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImageVersion.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Specifies whether this image is an AMI or a container image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImageVersion.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
Details for a specific version of an Image Builder image. This version follows the semantic version syntax.
The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.
Assignment: For the first three nodes you can assign any positive integer value, including zero, with an upper limit of 2^30-1, or 1073741823 for each node. Image Builder automatically assigns the build number to the fourth node.
Patterns: You can use any numeric pattern that adheres to the assignment requirements for the nodes that you can assign. For example, you might choose a software version pattern, such as 1.0.0, or a date, such as 2021.01.01.
Filtering: With semantic versioning, you have the flexibility to use wildcards (x) to specify the most recent versions or nodes when selecting the base image or components for your recipe. When you use a wildcard in any node, all nodes to the right of the first wildcard must also be wildcards.

member.summary:

The idempotency token of the component.

member.summary:

The data of the component. Used to specify the data inline. Either data or uri can be used to specify the data within the component.

member.summary:

The description of the component. Describes the contents of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImportComponentRequest.Format
member.summary:

The format of the resource that you want to import as a component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImportComponentRequest.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The ID of the KMS key that should be used to encrypt this component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImportComponentRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImportComponentRequest.Platform
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Platform.
The platform of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImportComponentRequest.SemanticVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SemanticVersion.
The semantic version of the component. This version follows the semantic version syntax.
The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.
Filtering: With semantic versioning, you have the flexibility to use wildcards (x) to specify the most recent versions or nodes when selecting the base image or components for your recipe. When you use a wildcard in any node, all nodes to the right of the first wildcard must also be wildcards.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImportComponentRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags of the component.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImportComponentRequest.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of the component denotes whether the component is used to build the image, or only to test it.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ImportComponentRequest.Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Uri.
The uri of the component. Must be an Amazon S3 URL and the requester must have permission to access the Amazon S3 bucket. If you use Amazon S3, you can specify component content up to your service quota. Either data or uri can be used to specify the data within the component.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.InstanceMetadataOptions
member.summary: The instance metadata options that apply to the HTTP requests that pipeline builds use to launch EC2 build and test instances. For more information about instance metadata options, see Configure the instance metadata options in the Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux instances, or Configure the instance metadata options in the Amazon EC2 Windows Guide for Windows instances.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.InstanceMetadataOptions.HttpPutResponseHopLimit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HttpPutResponseHopLimit.
Limit the number of hops that an instance metadata request can traverse to reach its destination.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.InstanceMetadataOptions.HttpTokens
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HttpTokens.
Indicates whether a signed token header is required for instance metadata retrieval requests. The values affect the response as follows:
required – When you retrieve the IAM role credentials, version 2.0 credentials are returned in all cases.
optional – You can include a signed token header in your request to retrieve instance metadata, or you can leave it out. If you include it, version 2.0 credentials are returned for the IAM role. Otherwise, version 1.0 credentials are returned.
The default setting is optional.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.LaunchPermissionConfiguration
member.summary: Describes the configuration for a launch permission. The launch permission modification request is sent to the Amazon EC2 ModifyImageAttribute API on behalf of the user for each Region they have selected to distribute the AMI. To make an AMI public, set the launch permission authorized accounts to all. See the examples for making an AMI public at Amazon EC2 ModifyImageAttribute.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ListComponentBuildVersionsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListComponentBuildVersions operation. Returns the list of component build versions for the specified semantic version.
The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.
Filtering: With semantic versioning, you have the flexibility to use wildcards (x) to specify the most recent versions or nodes when selecting the base image or components for your recipe. When you use a wildcard in any node, all nodes to the right of the first wildcard must also be wildcards.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ListComponentBuildVersionsRequest.ComponentVersionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ComponentVersionArn.
The component version Amazon Resource Name (ARN) whose versions you want to list.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum items to return in a request.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
A token to specify where to start paginating. This is the NextToken from a previously truncated response.

member.summary: This is the response object from the ListComponentBuildVersions operation.

member.summary:

The list of component summaries for the specified semantic version.

member.summary:

Filtering: With semantic versioning, you have the flexibility to use wildcards (x) to specify the most recent versions or nodes when selecting the base image or components for your recipe. When you use a wildcard in any node, all nodes to the right of the first wildcard must also be wildcards.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ListImagesResponse.ImageVersionList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageVersionList.
The list of image semantic versions.
The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.
Filtering: With semantic versioning, you have the flexibility to use wildcards (x) to specify the most recent versions or nodes when selecting the base image or components for your recipe. When you use a wildcard in any node, all nodes to the right of the first wildcard must also be wildcards.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Schedule
member.summary: A schedule configures how often and when a pipeline will automatically create a new image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Schedule.PipelineExecutionStartCondition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineExecutionStartCondition.
The condition configures when the pipeline should trigger a new image build. When the pipelineExecutionStartCondition is set to EXPRESSION_MATCH_AND_DEPENDENCY_UPDATES_AVAILABLE, and you use semantic version filters on the base image or components in your image recipe, EC2 Image Builder will build a new image only when there are new versions of the image or components in your recipe that match the semantic version filter. When it is set to EXPRESSION_MATCH_ONLY, it will build a new image every time the CRON expression matches the current time. For semantic version syntax, see CreateComponent in the EC2 Image Builder API Reference.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Schedule.ScheduleExpression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleExpression.
The cron expression determines how often EC2 Image Builder evaluates your pipelineExecutionStartCondition.
For information on how to format a cron expression in Image Builder, see Use cron expressions in EC2 Image Builder.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.Schedule.Timezone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Timezone.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.SystemsManagerAgent
member.summary: Contains settings for the Systems Manager agent on your build instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.SystemsManagerAgent.UninstallAfterBuild
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UninstallAfterBuild.
Controls whether the Systems Manager agent is removed from your final build image, prior to creating the new AMI. If this is set to true, then the agent is removed from the final image. If it's set to false, then the agent is left in, so that it is included in the new AMI. The default value is false.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateImagePipelineRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateImagePipeline operation. Updates an image pipeline. Image pipelines enable you to automate the creation and distribution of images.
UpdateImagePipeline does not support selective updates for the pipeline. You must specify all of the required properties in the update request, not just the properties that have changed.

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container pipeline to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateImagePipelineRequest.Description
member.summary:

The description of the image pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateImagePipelineRequest.DistributionConfigurationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DistributionConfigurationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution configuration that will be used to configure and distribute images updated by this image pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateImagePipelineRequest.EnhancedImageMetadataEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnhancedImageMetadataEnabled.
Collects additional information about the image being created, including the operating system (OS) version and package list. This information is used to enhance the overall experience of using EC2 Image Builder. Enabled by default.

member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image pipeline that you want to update.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the infrastructure configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.InfrastructureConfigurationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InfrastructureConfigurationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration that you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.InstanceMetadataOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceMetadataOptions.
The instance metadata options that you can set for the HTTP requests that pipeline builds use to launch EC2 build and test instances. For more information about instance metadata options, see one of the following links:
Configure the instance metadata options in the Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux instances.
Configure the instance metadata options in the Amazon EC2 Windows Guide for Windows instances.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.InstanceProfileName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceProfileName.
The instance profile to associate with the instance used to customize your Amazon EC2 AMI.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.InstanceTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceTypes.
The instance types of the infrastructure configuration. You can specify one or more instance types to use for this build. The service will pick one of these instance types based on availability.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.KeyPair
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KeyPair.
The key pair of the infrastructure configuration. You can use this to log on to and debug the instance used to create your image.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.Logging
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Logging.
The logging configuration of the infrastructure configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.ResourceTags
member.summary:

The tags attached to the resource created by Image Builder.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.SecurityGroupIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupIds.
The security group IDs to associate with the instance used to customize your Amazon EC2 AMI.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.SnsTopicArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnsTopicArn.
The SNS topic on which to send image build events.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.SubnetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubnetId.
The subnet ID to place the instance used to customize your Amazon EC2 AMI in.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.UpdateInfrastructureConfigurationRequest.TerminateInstanceOnFailure
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TerminateInstanceOnFailure.
The terminate instance on failure setting of the infrastructure configuration. Set to false if you want Image Builder to retain the instance used to configure your AMI if the build or test phase of your workflow fails.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.AmazonImagebuilderClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Imagebuilder
EC2 Image Builder is a fully managed Amazon Web Services service that makes it easier to automate the creation, management, and deployment of customized, secure, and up-to-date "golden" server images that are pre-installed and pre-configured with software and settings to meet specific IT standards.

member.name: P:Amazon.Imagebuilder.AmazonImagebuilderClient.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.Imagebuilder.AmazonImagebuilderClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonImagebuilderClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Imagebuilder.AmazonImagebuilderClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:

Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.summary:
Deletes an Image Builder image resource. This does not delete any EC2 AMIs or ECR container images that are created during the image build process. You must clean those up separately, using the appropriate Amazon EC2 or Amazon ECR console actions, or API or CLI commands.
To deregister an EC2 Linux AMI, see Deregister your Linux AMI in the Amazon EC2 User Guide .
To deregister an EC2 Windows AMI, see Deregister your Windows AMI in the Amazon EC2 Windows Guide .
To delete a container image from Amazon ECR, see Deleting an image in the Amazon ECR User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.Imagebuilder.AmazonImagebuilderClient.ListComponentBuildVersions(Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ListComponentBuildVersionsRequest)
member.summary:
Returns the list of component build versions for the specified semantic version.
The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.
Filtering: With semantic versioning, you have the flexibility to use wildcards (x) to specify the most recent versions or nodes when selecting the base image or components for your recipe. When you use a wildcard in any node, all nodes to the right of the first wildcard must also be wildcards.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListComponentBuildVersions service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListComponentBuildVersions service method, as returned by Imagebuilder.
member.exception: You have exceeded the permitted request rate for the specific operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Imagebuilder.IAmazonImagebuilder
member.summary:
Interface for accessing Imagebuilder
EC2 Image Builder is a fully managed Amazon Web Services service that makes it easier to automate the creation, management, and deployment of customized, secure, and up-to-date "golden" server images that are pre-installed and pre-configured with software and settings to meet specific IT standards.

member.name: M:Amazon.Imagebuilder.IAmazonImagebuilder.DeleteImage(Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.DeleteImageRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes an Image Builder image resource. This does not delete any EC2 AMIs or ECR container images that are created during the image build process. You must clean those up separately, using the appropriate Amazon EC2 or Amazon ECR console actions, or API or CLI commands.
To deregister an EC2 Linux AMI, see Deregister your Linux AMI in the Amazon EC2 User Guide .
To deregister an EC2 Windows AMI, see Deregister your Windows AMI in the Amazon EC2 Windows Guide .
To delete a container image from Amazon ECR, see Deleting an image in the Amazon ECR User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.Imagebuilder.IAmazonImagebuilder.ListComponentBuildVersions(Amazon.Imagebuilder.Model.ListComponentBuildVersionsRequest)
member.summary:
Returns the list of component build versions for the specified semantic version.
The semantic version has four nodes: <major>.<minor>.<patch>/<build>. You can assign values for the first three, and can filter on all of them.
Filtering: With semantic versioning, you have the flexibility to use wildcards (x) to specify the most recent versions or nodes when selecting the base image or components for your recipe. When you use a wildcard in any node, all nodes to the right of the first wildcard must also be wildcards.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListComponentBuildVersions service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListComponentBuildVersions service method, as returned by Imagebuilder.
member.exception: You have exceeded the permitted request rate for the specific operation.
